intro: Eligmocarpus cynometroides, commonly known as the purple-flowered sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, woody structure and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces oval, leathery fruits that contain a single seed, and its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinct aromatic scent. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in evergreen forests.
